citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
***In the Sheep enclosure there was one Sheep that had one long hoof on the lateral side of the right front leg. There was
no limping of this ewe observed during the inspection. The licensee stated that a recent staffing change had left them
short handed, they had not found anyone to provide hoof care yet and the veterinarian had not been contacted.
Long hooves that are left unattended can cause lameness in animals.
The licensee must have the hoof trimmed or contact the veterinarian for trimming and ensure that all animals are provided
with appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.
To be corrected by close of business August 18, 2023.

***In the Coati Mundi and Kangaroo building, there are areas of insulation board that have been scratched out by the
animals. The licensee stated that they do occasionally find insulation pieces on the floors of the enclosures, but they have
no knowledge of the animals trying to eat the insulation.
Areas of insulation that can be reached by animals creates an opportunity for ingestion or inhalation and the insulation will
not work as intended.
The licensee must repair these areas and ensure that housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be
maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
To be corrected by August 29, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and the facility representative.
